q: Asked about the media comparing him to former judge Paula Abdul , Steve Tyler laughed, saying it's because of the rehab rumors that dogged Paula Abdul . But he added that he'll be no Simon Cowell either. You can't say you suck, he told Howard Stern . " Simon Cowell got off on doing that. My heart's not like that... I'm not into putting people down. 's minister of state for antiquities Zahi Hawass said today. The objects missing from the famed museum included "a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess" and parts of a gilded wood statue of Tutankhamun harpooning, Zahi Hawass said. Looters broke into the museum in Cairo's Tahrir Square on January 28 when massive protests against Hosni Mubarak drove his police from the streets in a series of running battles. Also missing

army arrived, young Egyptians-- some armed with truncheons grabbed off the police-- created a human chain at the museum's front gate to prevent looters from making off with any of its priceless artifacts. They managed to stop them, Zahi Hawass said. He added that the would-be looters only managed to vandalize two mummies, ripping their heads off. They also cleared out the museum gift shop. and demanded Hosni Mubarak 's immediate ouster, Zahi Hawass said Egyptians should give his boss more time. "The people in the streets have to give this government an opportunity to change," he said cheerfully. Beautiful things happened in the last five days. Here is a partial transcript of the chat between Colin Powell and CNN's Candy Crowley : Candy Crowley : We are entering a Barack Obamaial campaign season. Do you see anyone currently in the Republican field that would prompt you to vote Republican in 2012 and not vote for the re-election of Barack Obama ? Anybody interest you in the Republican field? Colin Powell : I will always vote as I have throughout my life, for the person that I think is best qualified to be Barack Obama of the United States, and I don't adhere to a single party
